CatDescriptText: Solomon L. Page, 1875 Runnette Street, Penn Township and Reverend Carey Jones, 155 Mayflower Street ,Sixth Ward, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 31, 1957, pg. 2 with question: "Who is your ward chairman? Does he have any power?  Does he exert it?" Solomon L. Page's answer reads: "I know my ward chairman who happens to be a woman, very well.  She is very efficient, in fact, at times, she worries me too much.  She makes certain that voters get out to vote."  Reverend Carey Jones' answer reads: "I'm not registered to vote now, but I have been in past.  I've only been in this ward a short time and I don't know the ward chairman nor whether or not he has any power."
TitMainTitle: Solomon L. Page wearing eyeglasses, striped shirt, and dark jacket with pen in breast pocket, and Rev. Carey Jones standing in front of cars, with Corby's billboard in background
